channel.title: Making NPC's Talk on a Set Rate
channel.description: I kno the [code]misc.random(##)[/code] thing but I would like to know how to make it so that NPC's talk on a [b]set[/b] rate, not a random one.

item.title: Making NPC's Talk on a Set Rate
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Do it without using randoms. That causes too much CPU usage. Make a speechTimer for whatever you want to say.

Say you want it to say soething every 50 loops.

Put this in your process, then. if(++speechTimer >= 50) speechTimer %= 50;

Then where it says things, make it so that if(speechTimer == 0) – then the stuff to make it say it, I don’t have a source in front of me.

Read full topic
item.source: Making NPC's Talk on a Set Rate

item.title: Making NPC's Talk on a Set Rate
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“tythus, post:5, topic:75390”]IDEA! if (misc.random2(3) <= 3) {
So When Its Lower than 3 It Will Talk ^^ Please Tell Me If Its Wrong…[/quote]Hmm… I think that would lag the server, but I like the idea lol, I’ll try it. Thanks.
